thread.title: Injured Miami LB Kirby: The Coastal is ours
thread.title_full: Injured Miami LB Kirby: The Coastal is ours

title: Injured Miami LB Kirby: The Coastal is ours
text:
Injured Miami LB Kirby: The Coastal is ours 
Miami Hurricanes linebacker Raphael Kirby (56). Steve Mitchell / USA TODAY Sports Oct 20, 2015 at 11:00a ET 0Shares 
Miami linebacker Raphael Kirby may be down after sustaining a season-ending knee injury on Saturday, but his spirts are up. 
The Hurricanes senior linebacker and leading tackler injured his knee during Miami’s 30-20 victory over Virginia Tech on Saturday, but encouraged his teammates the next day when he tweeted: “Gonna miss this, I love my team! I expect great things! Coastal is ours #believe.” true — Raphael Kirby (@killaXkirb) October 18, 2015 
With a 4-2 (1-1) record, Miami is currently tied for fourth in the Coastal Division with Virginia and will be back in action this week when it hosts No. 6 Clemson (6-0, 3-0 ACC) at noon. MORE NEWS: Want stories delivered to you? Sign up for our College Football newsletters. 0
